yesterday my crazy aunt came unannounced. she went into the city with my mom & sisters. her daughter told me she'd been throwing up for the past few days. (they had/have the puke flu.) therefore, i had to escape my house & run to catherine's. (actually i drove.) we played sims2 with john the rest of the night, creating deranged families with fat teenagers, buhlimic bitches, and cute emo boys. i'll be in nyc until new year's as of tomorrow, so call me on my cellphone and maybe we can have really long conversations about nothing. picture post when i get back, slut bags.





and in case you didn't already hear, i'm marrying brian flowers.

buying & wrapping gifts has become my life lately i'm afraid that christmas is going to come & go too quickly today we went to rockefeller to go skating but i couldn't due to my knee therefore i bonded with an old lady the entire time she asked to listen to my ipod & told me she likes azure ray & dispatch that made me really happy for some reason so do black santa clauses standing on street corners ringing bells

catherine's kind of makes sense... the school holiday show yesterday was uberboring next year me & laura are going to do a feliz navidad duet complete with sombreros let me know if you want in

oar concert on nov 26 me & sophia at the oar concert this is what cocaine does to kids. elevator hotness. louie: my future husband. sleeping on the bus. victor: even better than tyler. definitely not going to school until lunch tomorrow and screw the effing concert rehearsal tonight god i am such a rebel i think my cleaning lady is a lesbian

ah, such a good day
city with rin & roy was uberfun
got almost all my presents & unfortunately spent $270
damn my un-being-able-to-say-no-to-vendors
trainride home was loud & hilarious
catherine threatened a little girl with her fist
an asian man thought we were criminally insane
it is now time to powerwrap 351ejk9#*1 presents
i love the holidays

Chorus makes me want to put a shotgun in my mouth and pull the trigger. Lately, I've found myself pretending to like people I despise, and I despise myself for it. Especially when those people are egotistical pathological liars, cynical hypocrites, and/or artificial bimbos. Doesn't it bother you when somebody is so utterly transparent you can see right through everything they say or do? Almost all the people in my life right now I find myself unable to talk to--to really talk to--without worrying they're judging me or will repeat every word I say to someone else. I feel like every time I leave a room I'm being criticized; I guess what comes around goes around. I hate that feeling of not knowing what you're feeling. I have no idea what's missing in my life, let alone how to fix it. "He who throws mud only loses ground." I find this quote quite deep, considering Fat Albert said it.

A very shitty weekend forebodes a very shitty week

11 Possible Causes of Stress: 1. I have purchased only 2 of my 9301547 Christmas presents. 2. An ten-page rough draft of our research paper is due next week. 3. The teachers will be packing the days leading up to break with tests galore. 4. Everybody is prettier than me. 5. My iPod is a frustrating son-of-a-bitch. 6. One of my best friends doesn't even want to send me a candy cane. 7. Hardcore PMS. 8. I have to face the brutal wrath of physical therapy tonight. 9. " " the nasty guido at " ". 10. Adam is an asshole. 11. Tomorrow we have a "mandatory" chorus rehearsal from 3-6.

Laura, can I borrow your musket?

no internet since friday = gross conference was fun. we met alot of armonk/tuckahoe people (ie: victor who is amazing "yeah conference 04!" and louie who is absolutely gorgeous). we also met some incredibly crazy christian's such as annie and stew. monday i forget what happened. tuesday i frantically tried to complete 25 research paper note cards in two periods and succeeded. then we went to the men's shelter and served them a holiday dinner-type-thing and saw nana (my favorite person in the world) who'd knitted us quite lovely winter hats (mine has balls on the top; catherine's has a mudflap). we got rather bored at one point and decided to talk about our futures, deciding that catherine would be a mountain-woman with either a shaved head or hair down to her feet, and will make homemade jerky out of the squirrels she hunts in the backyard of her rustic log cabin. laura will be a very successful doctor living in a suburb near boston and married to a lawyer that is never home, and has one child (a girl named mary) who is obviously raised by an aupair who cannot make proper lunches nor take her to the mall when she wants to. sophia will be a world-travelling feminist with a kabillion adopted children that she drives around in her black saab. i will apparently be an upscale journalist living in a penthouse in nyc with my 7 kids and rich old husband, and according to catherine i will wear sunglasses on my head everyday to hold back my bangs. i will also have 16 male mistresses imported from brazil. we'll all go to catherine's for the holidays; she'll make us jerky, laura'll bring the champagne (as well as a backpack full of pills and antibacterial lotion for her daughter), i will bring the assorted cheeses and freebies from work, and sophia'll bring the gifts. while me and laura sit next to the fire, catherine will teach our children to hunt wild raccoons and moose(s) in her yard with homemade spears and bows&arrows. the future looks bright. [neeners thx for posting this.]

my nose is still sore from the funeral tuesday. tomorrow we leave for conference, which should be fun considering who's going. sidenote: catherine's burps are lethal/vomit-inducing. the backyard/lake madeline & my cousin scott sporting a camo on camo outfit le chef! i sprayed mashed potatoes all over the kitchen while franne licked them up. lucy liked the mashed potatoes as well. we all waited... ...and waited... ...and waited for the food to cook. some of us played football. suckers. however, the cool kids stayed inside. i don't have many pictures of when the food came out for obvious reason. afterwards, we decided to lay down on the couch and digest. acid reflux, anyone? vin looks like a monkey in this picture. i love him. molly and erich are adorable together and make me want a boyfriend. damnit.

School today resembled a massive dark cloud waiting to burst into a horrible storm. Her friends had nothing to say, her friends' friends didn't know what to say, the teachers could barely speak. Every hallway was filled with people crying or about to cry. The fact that we'll never see her again, that we'll never be able to tell her she's beautiful, that we'll never be able to tell her how much she's loved... really hurts. Tomorrow I'm going to the service for her; hopefully it will bring some sort of closure, although right now that seems inconceivable. I hope the holidays will bring at least a little bit of happiness to Tina's friends and family. Or maybe it will just make things worse. At a time like this everything is confusing; there are so many questions left unanswered, so many doors left unshut. I tried to move more things into my new room today & do as much Christmas shopping as I could online just to take my mind off of things. It didn't help. Everything just seems so inconsequential right now.

I never thought I could cry this much about a person I knew so little. It's amazing how one thing one girl can say will affect you the rest of your life. Rest In Peace Tina Gambino. We'll all miss you so much. Time can bring you down, time can bend your knees Time can break your heart, have you begging please... Beyond the door there's peace I'm sure And I know there'll be no more tears in heaven...

the oar concert was absolute insanity.

+ insane afro-man dancing in the front row
- drunk guy spilling beer in my hair
+ potheads smoking joints in front of us
- headache after about 5 minutes
+ headache gone after about 20 minutes
- girl vomitting in the stall next to me whilst peeing
+ milkduds & redbull(s)
- catherine leaving before oar came on
+/- bluegrass opener playing 43189 songs
+ my new 'sexy bed voice'

i'm too tired/jittery to write everything.
definitely the best concert i've ever been to.
yes, it even rivals ninja turtles live at the garden.

i hope you all had a good thanksgiving!

1. Choose 15 people from your friends list at random.
2. Write something about/to each of them.
3. Don't tell anyone who the statements are about.

<lj-cut text="one, two, THREE">1. You have a really lame sense of humor.
2. I love you so much and I'm so glad you're in my life, but you need to learn how to tell others how you feel about them.
3. I like that you can be yourself no matter who you're with. I also like your choice in music.
4. We used to be best friends in elementary school. I like your hair. I wish we were closer.
5. You've become so much different than you used to be, and sometimes I feel like you're pretending to be somebody you're not. Please stop. I love you just the way you are.
6. I hope your throat feels better. We need to talk more.
7. Don't try to impress people so much by lying about what you've "done". Be yourself.
8. You need to stop being so shy and just go for it. Who cares what happens?
9. I think you are one of the coolest/prettiest people I have ever known. I love reading your entries.
10. I like to kick your books out from the bottom of your desk. Make me something cool for my birthday.
11. I used to worry about what your future would turn out like, but frankly I don't care anymore. I think you're pathetic.
12. I miss camp. FAH-JEE-TAHS. I think I'm seeing you on Saturday and that makes me happy.
13. I've been in love with you since I was four, but now that's starting to change. You smell good.
14. We're growing apart. You need to learn how to speak your mind and stop complaining behind other people's backs. I wish things would just be normal again.
15. You're the most awesome Asian I've ever met. I'm glad we've become closer since being in highschool.</lj-cut>

I have to be at my Area All-State Concert in an hour. I've been singing for the past 8 hours. Call my cellphone; I want to chat. Happy birthday Frank.

I love how our nation's future relies on midwestern hicks, ignorant christians, italian catholics, wealthy assholes, and uneducated people in general. Do I respect other peoples' opinions? Yes. But somehow I can't bring myself to understand why anybody who would want to vote/support a president who wants ownership of American womens' bodies, prohibits people who are in love to make their marriage legal, and who fucks up our alliances with other countries so much that we are now the most hated nation in the world. I guess it's just been a bad day. Or maybe a just bad past four years.
Note: FUCK YOU OHIO.

+spanish class yesterday -bush loving jocks +my new boots come this weekend -jalil pretending to be dead in his locker today +a poloroid of danny clark i stole for cath's locker -area allstate rehearsal for 5 hours straight tomorrow +we won the last game so, i can't decide if i should have (a) a mexican fiesta (b) an 80s prom night for my sweet sixteen in december i'm leaning towards the fiesta help meeeeee oh, and everybody make tyler do play kthxbye

i hate when i don't know how to describe what i'm feeling. i guess i just don't want us to separate so much that we won't be able to fit back together again, and i feel like that's exactly what's going to happen. we used to be so much more... something else. and that's leaving now, or maybe it's already left. but maybe it's hasn't (?). it's only october, we have a year until next summer. i guess we'll just see what happens.

things that happened this week were okay. besides study hall with chris/zach friday, conversations with tyler/kacie/alex in spanish, neeners' purplish hair (tres hot, btw), my newly dark (again) hair, trying to plan out my sweet16 guest list/party, & the beyond hot waiter (that cute, nerdy type) at rosa mexicana today... things have been irritatingly the same.

i'll stop now; i can see where this is going. it will turn into some sort of anti-westchester/highschool entry like 4389301 others. it's late. i'm always moody and pessimistic when it's late. maybe i should just go to sleep and think about it all in the morning.

The bullfight in Spanish made me so sick. CSI tonight at Brielle's made me sicker. But watching the pep ralley was probably what made me the sickest.

My evening consisted of a war between three evil ninjas/samurai warriors with supernatural powers, such as using one's flatulence to knock out the other ninja/samurai warrior. Yeah, it was fun. Of course, I won, along with my secret ninja lover LG, and we preceded to eat pizza crust and watch Degrassi.

Tomorrow morning is the PSAT. Somehow taking a 3 hour test at 8 in the morning that won't count for anything doesn't really appeal to me.

There's supposed to be this giant tag sale in Central Park tomorrow, but of course I'm missing it due to my stupid knee and the money I need to make. Damnit.

[Sorry for what happened tonight. Call me if you see this. If not, I'll talk to you tomorrow.]

All around me are familiar faces Worn out places, worn out faces Bright and early for their daily races Going nowhere, going nowhere Their tears are filling up their glasses No expression, no expression Hide my head I want to drown my sorrow No tomorrow, no tomorrow And I find it kinda funny, I find it kinda sad The dreams in which I'm dying are the best I've ever had I find it hard to tell you, I find it hard to take When people run in circles it's a very very Mad world Yesterday, Jalil compared Laura to Latoya Jackson. That, and him admitting he diarreahed his pants when he was four and threw them out the window, only to have his mother find them a few days later, was the highlight of my day. I feel so weird lately. Like things are happening but not really happening. There's not much of a difference between happiness and sadness. I told Sophia today that after school ends, I can't remember what happened. Is that weird? I talked to Kevin last night. I finally told him that I felt that I couldn't trust him and that I couldn't talk to him because I knew he didn't care. I think that really hurt him and I'm glad. I think I'm going to stop talking about him to other people, though. It just makes me get this tight feeling in my throat and my eyes start to burn. I'd rather be numb to it all then actually feel. He goes back to Florida tomorrow. The bonfire tomorrow should be fun. Is anyone actually going to the dance? My mom's not home the entire weekend which means I can basically do whatever. My dad's a little hopeless when it comes to parenting. I should probably get some of this fucking homework done before my two hour physical therapy session and the county leaders meeting tonight.

school was weird. nothing happened. at all. don told me it was his last day working at my physical therapy place today. i almost cried. he's one of the coolest people i've ever met, and i've only known him two weeks. now i'm with the greasy guido-italian from westlake. i decided i'm going to go tuesday afternoons though; that's when the broken-shouldered guy goes. his name is richard, he is very tan& he wore a led zeppelin tshirt today. hard yet?

voice lesson went well, kind of killed my throat though. afterwards i had that sexy demi moore voice. he made me do scales starting at the c above high c. i've been drinking 4381902 mugs of tea daily. i still haven't decided on what song i want to do for nyssma. i found out i got into area all-state chorus though (!), so that made my day alot better. doc told me that on the town, or whatever its called, isn't all that bad, good songs. sounds fucktarded though, so i guess the wiz is still my choice.

momo if i come in tomorrow and our hallway isn't decorated, i'm beating your ass down to the ground with my crutch. yeah, kind of like today X 8437189

i realized today that i still haven't gotten miranda/karla's birthday presents. miranda's birthday was a few days after i broke my knee, karla's was the day before my surgery. so i guess i have a good enough excuse.

kevin's getting out of rehab tomorrow i think. that's bad though, because then he's back in the so-called "program" in florida, where he relapsed about two weeks ago. my mom's really stressing out. it's weird though, because for the first time i'm not. once it soaks in a bit, i'll probably get all messed up about it again. but there's seriously nothing else i can do. i've written him as many letters & poems, cried to him too many times, cried about him too many times... right now i'm just too worn out from his bullshit to <s>care</s> think about it.

and i'm not so sure that's a bad thing.

I've been beginning to hate myself lately. I say things and mean another. My promises always end up broken. I think too much of little things, and not enough about the important ones. At the end of the summer I loved how free I felt of all the drama that came out of my relationships: friends, guys, family. It all just felt so trivial. And now I'm back in the same position I was at the end of last year and I don't like it. Back to being caught in the middle of battles and led on by a guy I swore I'd never talk to again. Too many secrets, too many lies. It all needs to stop. But at the same time I don't want to mess anything up, hurt anyone, do something I'll regret later, or be held responsible for things out of my control.


Anyway, the light outside is beautiful so I'm off to take some photographs. Hope I don't fall down the stairs or anything.

So, besides Mr Ingram making the chorus sing to me during warm ups: "Kerrie Lopez/Is on crutches/She broke her knee/During field hockey" followed by a god awful crooning of "Welcome baaaaaaack" & clapping (my face must have turned seventy three shades of crimson), Having the toad-like substitute & Mr Jackson follow me around, Mrs Santare referring to me infront of the class as "that girl on crutches", Sitting amongst the flatulent football players during study hall (Thank you, Chris and Zach, for leaving me to the wrath of the savages), And spending almost three hours in physical therapy this afternoon (There are rather good-looking young gentlemen there, I must admit)... I had a fabulous day. I only caught the tale end of the VP debate; Dickling, I must admit was demoloshing mAh BoI. You know what rocks the most about breaking my knee? I don't have to pretend to even remotely like Mrs Meade, The white-tongued, jelly-legged, mole-ridden beast, Every second period for the first semester, Due to the fact that I can't play the bass. Damn.

indieskate21:  said kerry's mom
Auto response from cherry15k: "i mean, i always kind of empty your pockets subconciously because kevin would leave cigarettes, you'd leave lipgloss, and madeline would leave twigs."
indieskate21: fuck
indieskate21: i mean kerrie
indieskate21: damn, sorry
indieskate21: you know i love you

It's true. Tonight my mother casually said, "I always kind of empty your pockets subconciously. I guess it's because Kevin leaves cigarettes, you leave lipgloss, and Madeline leaves twigs." And when I laughed she didn't even know why.

I came home to find a box of empty Milanos sitting on the counter. I then found out that the barbarians (Laura and Catherine, for short) had come into my house when I was not home, devoured my kitchen, and pooped on my curtains. True story. Most of it anyway.

So the highlight of my day was shaving my legs. Is that weird?

this is the perfect weather. dark, dreary, and rainy. laguna beach premieres tonight and i'm excited. & rather pathetic, come to think of it. today i was tutored for two hours in chem, my crackhead spanish tutor forgot to come. l and c came over for a bit to raid my kitchen. i kind of feel like they only come over for the food. [they arrive.] "hey kerrie." "god, i'm soaked." "let's go clean up." [five minutes go by.] "kerrie, we're making guacamole!" [make guacamole & eat it.] "kerrie, we're making pizza!" sorry guys, but it's true. so, we realized today, after we'd already painted my new room, that the pink was way brighter and darker than on the sample. so now we have to repaint the whole thing. and the skirts i was going to get are now sold out. time to go bang some lampshades.

"20 Things That Have Been Pissing Me Off As Of Late" By: Myself 1. when people put <3 after everything they say. 2. when people put LOL! after everything they say. 3. jordan knight from the surreal life: boy band icon turned skeevy fat has-been. 4. secrets that need not be kept. 5. selfish guys who need women to make them feel superior. 6. girls who need a guy to make them feel good about themselves. 7. when a chocolate looks really good & turns out to have a nasty filling. 8. the metaphorical sense of #7. 9. when people can't take criticism well and try to retaliate, making themselves look even more retarded. 10. when you can tell someone is stalling to ask you an important question. 11. those fucking "from, karen" commercials on MTV. they're not even dumb enough to be funny. 12. when somebody says they've done something, and you know they haven't. 13. everyone whose going to ask me if one of these pertains to them. don't. because i'm not going to tell you unless it's necessary. 14. girls who completely change to be accepted by others. 15. waking up from really good dreams. 16. when words and phrases get overused. 17. freshmen who give you bitch stares. 18. transparency. 19. people who know one song by the band that's on their tshirt, or by whose lyrics are in their profiles. 20. having enough anger to write a list of 20 things that piss me off.

Had a good night filled with pumpkin-scented candle wax, my porch glider, a blue comforter, and deep conversations with Sophia. I felt really shitty about my knee today, I guess realizing that I've been being selfish always wanting people to come over. I probably wouldn't want always be at my house either when I could be doing better things with my time. It's just I spend the whole week waiting for the weekend so I can see people... and tonight when I couldn't I just felt really bad. But it's not your fault, so don't think this entry is my trying to make you feel guilty. I promise.

I'm dreading going on AIM for fear of him IMing me again. I don't want this. But I do. I have a problem and I need help. Sophia, thanks for listening to me tonight. We need to do that much more often. But next time, we're not talking about me "acting buhlimic" because I'm not. That was amusing.

I lifted my leg for the first time today at physical therapy--all by myeffingself!-- and when I burst into my house telling my dad and anyone who would listen they kind of just stared at me and then nodded their head faking enthusiasm. But it was a big deal. For me anyway. And then of course when my mom asked to see it, trying to make me feel all accomplished and such, I couldn't do it. Fuck.

He talked to me. That wasn't supposed to happen. I starved myself from speaking to him. I was so proud of myself for not thinking of him for two whole months. And then he had to go and ruin it. I hate him. No, I loathe him. Is there a difference? Loathe sounds worse. He's selfish and conceited and so fucking controlling. And now I'm going to be dragged into his whole world again. And the worst part is I almost want to be... God, sorry for all this vagueness. It's the PMS. I need to talk to somebody. I'm calling you. You're not there. Shit. I'm a hypocrite. I always get pissed when people write entries that I get confused with. So I'm stopping. And since I know all of you want an excuse to stop doing homework, give a cripple something to do: 1. Think of a word you would use to describe me. 2. Go to Google Image Search and search for that word. 3. Select the picture you see as most fitting, and post it as a reply. 4. Post this meme in your journal.

Today was a good day. My mom wakes me up at 9 so I can "start treating the day like a regular school day". I sit on the couch for a few hours doing homework, waiting for one of my freak show tutors to show up, they come, ask me how my knee is, check the work, leave. I'm starting to except this whole sitting-on-couch-for-infinity predicament. I did get up briefly and go to Cosi with Karla though, which was nice--except for the group of moms that pretend they're still 16 pushing their newborns in strollers talking vociferously at the table next to us. Way to ruin a turkey and brie sandwich, honey. Despite my mom's idea to turn hospital bracelets into the newest trend ["Instead of writing one's name in that white space, you could write "MOODY" or "HOTTIE".] I cut the green one off today. Sorry, babes. I'm actually a little wary about going back to school, whenever that may happen, because of a certain someone who is in the middle of a certain frustrating situation with a certain somebody else. I won't say anything more about that except that it's going to be dejavu from last year. Ehgk. I rented Mean Girls to watch tonight and I'm so effing excited. God, how I love Lindsay Lohan, even if half of her torso is amassed mainly of silicone and other surgically injected substances. It's amazing how casually we talk about plastic surgery today, really. Mothers buying a new pair of boobs for their daughters for a graduation present, fathers paying for their nose jobs because they feel self concious. Ten years ago if someone had told me that their chest was filled with various polymeric organic silicon compounds made of oils, greases, and plastics, I would have vomited in their faces. But today? Today they're cures for low self-esteem and a bad gene makeup. Bizarre. Enough of my ranting on the corrupt social morals of our world. I'm going to go watch my god damn movie.

An email I got from my good friend Vin; kerrie, my love: as you already know, i'm currently ass-deep in the world of publishing. which entails a certain degree of grammaticalist abilitees. the likes of which will not be seen here, in this gem of a paperback. this one's got BESTSELLER written all over it. and certainly, those online translation algorithms have come a long way. but somewhere in the world, there IS a manuscript editor who's in dire need of a pink slip. hope life is stupendous on your end. hasta. -v- ps. the covers i've done are nowhere near this excellent. Is it sad that this Japanese book on healing depression by doing anus clenches just appealed to me?

Today was uneventful and boring. The 6'4 beast woman--I mean english & social studies tutor--came for a few hours in the afternoon. Then The Mancini stopped by. [Note to Sophia: I need that work she's been giving you for me!] I had a conversation with Karla's friend(Maya Krinsky)'s boyfriend about knees and bananas. It was odd. He was really hot. Damn Maya to hell. Then I had some soup. Then I watched yet another rerun of The Surreal Life because Flava Flave never gets old. So now I'm just sitting here looking on Urban Outfitters for skirts. That's one benefit of this whole knee-situation: my mom buys me sympathy clothing, and for the first time since the 4th grade she told me I need more skirts, because that's all I can really wear right now. Anand just IMed me: AntiShadow666: whos this AntiShadow666: ?? AntiShadow666: hello? cherry15k: kerrie cherry15k: whose this? AntiShadow666: haha the cripple AntiShadow666: lol just kidding me too cherry15k: damnn straight AntiShadow666: its anand, that indian kid cherry15k: haha AntiShadow666: ya cherry15k: hey AntiShadow666: hey whats up AntiShadow666: how long r u outta school for cherry15k: til october cherry15k: you? AntiShadow666: hopefully next week AntiShadow666: being home sucks alot cherry15k: ugh i know cherry15k: whatd you do? cherry15k: break-wise AntiShadow666: watch informercials AntiShadow666: nah, i rent alot of movies AntiShadow666: i heard your break was bad, wut happened? AntiShadow666: oh AntiShadow666: um, i broke my femur at the bottom, near the growth plate cherry15k: yikes cherry15k: i split my kneecap in half & got surgery AntiShadow666: nah, it wasnt as bad as yours from what i heard cherry15k: yeah mine wasn't too pleasant cherry15k: are you in a cast? AntiShadow666: that stinks, but i also had too get surgery cherry15k: high five it AntiShadow666: back at ya cherry15k: howd you break it? AntiShadow666: sirus AntiShadow666: it was in football practice right befor out first game, sirus ran into my leg and the knee bent the wrong way cherry15k: that boy has issues. AntiShadow666: ya cherry15k: yeah mine was completely my fault. AntiShadow666: whatd u do AntiShadow666: i heard u just fell over cherry15k: well, when you put it that way.. AntiShadow666: ...? cherry15k: ACTUALLY, me and laura were singing and i went down to do one of those rockstar lunges with my field hockey stick has my microphone and all of a sudden i heard a snap and felt my knee pop out and i fell. AntiShadow666: um AntiShadow666: well yea urs is kinda ur fault AntiShadow666: but it still sucks So that was me and Anand bonding. He heard I just fell over. Yes, that is what happened. But the story is still somewhat exciting. And it's always fun to exaggerate a bit. If I get back to school and everyone says "HEY KERRIE! I HEARD YOU FELL OVER!" I will be pissed. So from now on, let's pretend that I got mauled by a vicious polar bear. Got that? Good.

First time updating in what seems like forever. Most of you know that my surgery ended up being three hours instead of one, and that I stayed over night instead of left an hour after. I'm one of the lucky people who get sick from morphine, so I threw up what seems like three thousand times during my stay. Various people came to visit me, bringing balloons and flowers, but I don't really remember anything but whispering thanks and then throwing up some more. And at some point during the night I was just dry heaving because I hadn't eaten anything, thus having nothing to throw up. Gross. These last two weeks have been the most boring of my entire life. Everyone is back in school but me so all I do is lie around all day watching reruns and QVC. The ironic thing is I really don't enjoy watching television. It makes me frustrated because they replay the same show up to five times in one day. I've read and reread every magazine I have. Organized all of my photo albums. Read some books. Those of you who get to go to school shouldn't take it for granted. I could go on and on about how sorry I feel for myself, but I won't. Kristen's party was incredible. Being out of my house = Heaven. Sitting on the couch for two straight hours with Chris Mo Sophia Laura Karen Ally Joelle and whoever else was there = Hilarious. Anthony's band, Christ child or us and Him = Unneccessarily loud, but good. Stealing the microphone with Sophia and rocking out with some Ashlee Simpson = Feckin' great. I can't wait until I get those pictures back, especially the one of Mo with my crutch. Saucy. When I first broke my knee, all anyone would say to me was "Everything happens for a reason." I was getting pretty fucking sick of hearing that. But the reasons are beginning to show. I realized how much I'm loved, something I've needed to realize for a while. I have an amazing group of friends and a family that cares about me so much; I used to take that for granted. Cards, flowers, balloons, stuffed animals, food, and presents have been coming daily and for that I am truly thankful to everybody. I sound like such a crippled corn-ball--like in one of those "REALLIFE!" articles you read in magazines--but it's so true. I love you all.

The only thing that makes me cry more than thinking about my knee, and everything I can't do, is when people are nice. It's weird. Today when my mom and I were on our way to Plaza Video, she stopped at the gas station to fill up, and the guy that was filling our tank asked me what had happened and when I told him he reassured me that things would be alright, that I'd get through this. I mean, it's this random guy that I'd never met, a complete stranger, and there he was... just being so nice and sympathetic, and I just broke down. Even people I haven't talked to since school ended, or maybe longer, have been IMing me or calling me and saying they heard about my knee and they're so sorry. It makes me feel so guilty, because when this first happened, everyone I saw or talked to... I just wished that they could be going through this with me, not just hearing about it... but actually experiencing it, and for that I feel selfish and self-centered, and the guilt just piles up. And it's even worse when people I love say things. My mom, my sisters, my cousins, my friends... telling me that there's a reason for everything, looking on the bright side, just smiling and helping me in any way they can. It makes me feel so lucky to have this kind of support... so lucky it makes me cry. Rereading my entry before my last one is really tough. It was this naive girl talking about how excited she was that she was missing practice for a few days and going on this amazing trip with her three best friends. And then, out of nowhere, it just crumbles... falls apart. I want so badly to go to practice, for the first time I wish I could run two miles at 8 every single morning. God, I don't know. I just feel so fucking stupid. lilmidget52489: ciz i luv u and i would be really sad if u were out for the whole season Xo Smo0ch2 oX: that sucks for you and your team cus your like awesome and probly gonna be the captain stewieDaMizzan: I WANT TO HAVE SEX WITH YOUR KNEE. tell it taht.

Hmm, let's see what did Kerrie do today?
Oh. Right. Fractured her knee.


Yeah. So I went to practice this morning: ran, did drills. And, as we were warming up the goalie, me and Laura started horsing around and singing Disney songs. Well, I went down to do a rockstar pose (lounged forward and used my stick as a microphone), when all of a sudden I feel my kneecap pop out of my leg, snap, and pop back in, all in the course of two seconds. So I hear it slide against another bone/muscle and crack and collapse in pain. It took a few seconds for the team to realize I wasn't faking it... that I was crying hysterically and couldn't get up, and then they all stampeded over, as others got ice, and Brielle started stroking my head. It all happened to fast and right now I just can't absorb it, even though it's been almost exactly 12 hours since <lj-cut text="it happened.">

After a half hour of lying in the middle of the field unable to move, my sister came to pick me up... the coach & Brielle carried me to her car and slid me in. I couldn't stop crying and choking on my spit and tears. We drove over to the hospital, in which I had to wheel myself around on a wheelchair... I have a newfound respect for crippled people, I honestly never knew how horrible it is to be so humiliated and looked down upon with eyes filled with utmost pity, as you try to find a ramp or a door big enough to accomadate your vehicle. Terrible. 

So I went inside, got X-rayed, then saw some psycho, nut-job doctor who asked me if I could straighten my leg (it's still stuck in this half bent position from when I fell), and when I replied, "No.", he preceded to move my leg horizontal to my hips as I screamed and told him to stop. And then he just "hmphed" and looked at the X-rays, sighing every few minutes, only to inform me that I had broken off a piece of my kneecap (a fracture, apparently) and that it was something he'd "never seen before in the history of his employance" (not the greatest thing to tell an emotionally-unstable, worried fuck whose suffering from excrutiating pain), and that if it healed over the weekend I'd be able to play in a few weeks, but if not I have to get surgery sometime next week and am out the entire season... which fucking completely sucks because my coach just told me that I'm the starting center forward, and had a good chance of becoming captain. And after all I put up with last year with the upperclassmen... it just seems so worthless now. <lj-cut>

To top not playing this season off, the trip I've been looking forward to all summer, Cape Cod with Laura, Cath, Sophia, Christina, Kat, and Karen... I now cannot go on. Oh, but my doctor said I could go, that it wouldn't affect the healing process, and Mrs. Meberg said she's fine with me going... but then Christina's mom had to be all "nurse-like" and tell me I can't go. Is it really her place to decide if I can see my friends whom I haven't seen all summer because I've been working? Or if yet another memory can be had without me while I sit on my crippled ass at home, the same home I've been at all summer?

I hate not being able to walk anywhere. To simply get up and answer the phone. Or get myself a drink. Or walk up a flight of stairs. Or get dressed. Or take a shower. Or even go to the fucking bathroom without help.

Tell me, God, do you plan to fuck over my summer any more than you already have? Why don't you just shoot me with a lightening bolt? Or, is that too much to ask?

My eyes are burning from all the salt they've projected, and I'm sure staring at the computer screen is probably making it worse... and I have to figure out how I'm going to get out of this chair and escort myself into bed in a way that won't take a fucking month.

Jesus, my dad is such an incompitant jerk. I just finished screaming at him to actually try and be a normal father: to be patient and helpful, not pissy and nagging all the time. I asked him to show me how to work his digital camera, so he just tells me the general buttons, and all of a sudden I'm across the room fooling around with it (being completely fucking careful) and he screams at me to not open and close it so much or something. god fucking damnit. It just seems so much more trivial and childish as I'm typing this, but I guess it's just rooted from other things that have happened in the past. AJFKLAJFL. Got up and ran a few miles, did field hockey drills, followed by sprints, which actually weren't too bad. If I ever had Suds as my coach I would seriously consider drinking something highly toxic. Got home and relaxed a bit until Catherine had to force me to walk into town. Blahblah hung out on the church steps (it's what the cool kids do), talked to Emily, saw Doug briefly, and uh... Really did nothing until the field hockey "bonding" party tonight, in which hords of teen-angst-ridden freshmen sat around in my backyard eating the pounds and pounds of food that everyone brought. (I feel absolutely disgusting.) It actually sort of brought us closer: some of them became alot less shy around us, and I found out alot about hookups they've had with older guys, I won't go into depth as to allow you to not vomit all over your computer. So it was good, I guess, and tomorrow I shall practice for the last time until NEXT TUESDAY (!!!), which is amazing. Cape Cod = Party Like It's 1999. Mischief managed. < Gill, that's for you.

Tonight was fun. Hung out on the porch of the John Kerry Fundraiser with Laura, Joe, Deidre, Shannon, and some other cool kids. Went on a mission that ended in dancing on DT's back porch, getting eaten to death by bugs, and eventually going inside to watch Laura do horrific Sound of Music numbers while me, Joe, and Deidre did model poses on the couch. Oh yes, and there were some Gillets there [young Gilroys]. The rest is too confusing to right, and I need to drink some Red Bull whilst I search for my family because they appear to not be home. Hmm... ran away to Canada? I wouldn't put it beneath them. EDIT I won't be home the entire weekend because I'm going up to the Adirondacks to visit my grandparents and go to the Town Fair. Yee haw! So call my cell phone alot after 9 so I don't kill myself. KTHXBYE.

Ew, I'm back in this small, boring town we call home. I'm kind of relieved, not having to be in a state filled with Bush-loving hicks [wow, that wasn't stereotypical] anymore. It was quite fun, but when you see signs that read PEANUTS, BACON, AND GUNS! you know it's time to leave. Hurricane Charley hit us while we were there yesterday and the day before, and I was so fucking scared our house was going to get knocked over. Wind and rain and puddles the size of ponds = not fun. But somehow I enjoyed it. I hung out alot with this kid Jack and his friends, which I forget the names of. Dana and Billy? Eh, I forget. But Jack was awesome and wore a John Deere trucker hat. I wish I was back there right now. I hate saying goodbye to things. Tomorrow I begin cleaning out the room that I shall get in September. Tuesday I'm hoping I can go into the city, because my fucking jeans that I payed $15 on TWICE to get repaired (the right side of the crotch ripped, followed by the left) are now ripping in the ASS. So that blows. I hate saying goodbye to things. Wednesday preseason begins. I think I just threw up a little in my mouth. I don't feel like getting up at 7 or 8 every morning to run two and a half miles in the heat of August, when I could be sleeping in and being lazy. Summer's nearly over. I hate saying goodbye to things.

1. Chicago last night was amazing. 2. Laura comes home tomorrow. 3. Evan has humongous boobs. 4. I have to write people letters at camp [S,R,A,A,M,B]. 5. I bought the new(er) OAR CD, and am jealous that James gets to see them in concert on Saturday and I can't. 6. After taking the utmost consideration of this, I bought the Ashlee Simpson today. And to tell you the truth, it's not horrible. I've only listened to the first few songs as of yet, however, so it may turn ugly. 7. Summer is moving to quickly, and I don't want this week to end. 8. I go to North Carolina on Saturday for the week. Miss me. 9. Preseason starts in fucking two weeks. How did that happen? 10. My dad bought me a new scanner for my biology regents grade, but I can't figure out how it works. Help? 11. A.Ska needs to get me Kevin's CD. Alanna needs to burn me Taking Back Sunday. 12. My hands are covered in tattooes that my camp group drew on me. And I have a bruise on my butt from where Gregory "played pattycake". WTF. 12. I am tired and poor, and going to bed.

Who watches the Apprentice? I got the punk-girl's username from somebody. If you wanna check it out it's /patiencekills. Go check it out. Or... don't. So, anyway, I just got back to the city, in which I bought not too much stuff, which I guess should make me happy because I usually over-spend, but I felt like a reject walking around with only two bags. It brought down my self esteem a little. But then a gross man on the street told me he liked my braces. So that was nice. Um. Kind of. OH AND I GOT THE COOLEST GLASSES, EVEN IF THEY MAKE ME LOOK INSECTLIKE. I talked to Laura today, which was good. I feel bad because I really did want to go to field hockey camp, but it would've been stupid to screw myself over for my job this summer and next summer. Bah, whatever. At camp, I had to listen to kids tell the "Why did the chicken cross the road?" joke, about 5000 times because we had "JOKE TIME" at the end of camp. Fuck. I was pondering shooting myself. But I guess that would've caused somewhat of a commotion amongst the children. Hm, what else? Oh. Right. Catherine smells her crotch on the middle of the train and hits on middle aged state troopers and conductors. What a weirdo.

I got home from the mall much later than expected. [Lo siento C&S.] I got an awesome belt from Banana Republic for $5 because the cash register couldn't find a price anywhere, and was too fed up to find it, so ended up just saying "Uh, I think it's $4.99". So I was fine with saying "I think that sounds about right." I just had a Scattegories battle with Steve and Karla. Very fun. I should really start reading that AP book... Hahahhahahahhahahahahahahahahhahaha. Right.

My fingernails encrusted with citronella wax; My arms and shoulders covered in mosquito bites. A milkyway of fireflies outside my window fly as the hum of crickets lull me to sleep. Cars pump by with windows wide. People discuss love and life on their porches at dusk; a hazy glow of streetlights and candles flickering in their mellow faces...

I'm deliriously happy in this bubble we call summer and I don't want it to ever end.

I hate time and change.
I hate months and years. 
I hate calendars and birthdays.
I wish everything could just be paused.
That we could preserve who we once were.
...And who others used to be.

When I was little all I wanted to do was fast forward time so that I could grow up and stay up late and kiss boys and drive cars and explore far away places. Now I wish I could have my crayons and coloring books back, that i could scream at the top of my lungs in public and nobody would stare, that i could sit in my mother's lap and listen to her read me picture books filled with color and imagination and fantasy.

Ironic, isn't it?

meee &ally all partied out - i changed my layout. - it's raining. - i got another hug today. - ASDKLASJFA! CATHERINA&LAURA&SOPHIA ARE COMING HOME TODAY! - i don't want summer to be over or field hockey to start. - everyone should go see farhenheit 9/11. - alanna, forget about it, that whole situation seems like a bad episode of degrassi. - i'm in a retarded fight with my cousin! woo!

Summer is going by so fast, I feel like I hardly have a chance to catch my breath and enjoy it in full. Catherine, Laura, and Sophia all return on Saturday, and Karla comes back Friday night. Has a month really already gone by? The first two weeks went so fast because of work, and then last week and this week my cousin came and stayed with me which was so much fun. We actually didn't get sick of eachother, which is a first. I hated when she left though, not only because I probably won't see her until this winter, but it means I have to start running again and getting in shape for field hockey. Camp for that starts in a week and a half and preseason shortly after. I can't believe how quickly everything seems to be happening.

The past seven days of Laura's visit was filled with city trips and laughing so hard it hurts. I saw NYU, my dream college since I was five, and looooved it.  So much. We went because my cousin is considering applying to it. It's just perfect: the location, the classes, the dorms, the people, the internships, the abroad school in Florence... everything. I was thinking alot about time though. Considering how fast this year went, I can only imagine how fast time will fly until we'll be filling out applications and saying our last goodbyes. Scary.

And now it is time to ramble on and on about my hair. Firstly, thank you all for helping me make the decision whether or not to do it, and how to. I ended up dying it "Amber Shimmer" and I love it. It's not too drastically light, and it has a cool look in the sun. I took alot of pictures so I'll post them, even though many of you will get the privelege to see it first person! Ahh! Not. But seriously, your advice helped, even if alot of the comments I didn't get until after it was done. I'm afraid I'm going to become a bit of an addict to dyeing it, however.

Alrighty. Time to cut this short. Karla just called to tell me about Spain, I have to download a virus destroyer to my computer, and Madeline was just diagnosed with sclerosis (her spine is really curved), therefore my mom has decided to have a family night. Ugh. Wish me luck.

i'm planning on dying my hair tonight but i don't know: 1. if i should 2. what to do with it i'm going to most likely dye it a light reddy brown like marykate olsen's (( )), with blonde streaks, but i have no idea if it will look good or if it will be too drastic. i want a change though. and summer is the best time to experiment. so pleeease if you have a second, just say yes (dye it) or no (don't dye it) or let me know what you think.

drown me in a pool of i-don't-care strangle me with a rope of i-wasn't-there ...i guess that kind of sums up how i'm feeling right now. my cousin just left, every wild memory seemed to not involve me, therefore i decided to just not talk. yes, including the person who has agreed to let you stay at your house for a week and take you to see colleges, etc. would be a nice idea, but maybe it's a bit over your head. ok, that was harsh. whatever. i'm over it. they hadn't seen eachother in a while, and i can't not let them talk about fun times they have had. but honestly, including the third person is usually a good idea. i need to get out of this house. i need to see new faces. i need to go on new adventures. i'm a spoiled little bitch who needs to get over herself and stop being overly dramatic. but that's me. take it or leave it. oh and ps, if you read this and know it's about you, because i know you will, i seriously don't care anymore so let's just forget about it.

went to my grandpa's lake all day today: so much fucking fun. i brought suzanne up, and franne, tyler, and chelsea were all up there. tyler brought his friend trevor, who actually spoke this time, and turned out to be pretty cool. and he's hot, so that's cool too. here is my urea-filled day: me and suzanne and franne took the rowboat out to these woody islands they have in the middle of the lake: bad idea. i think i peed in my pants, seriously. i can't even describe the fun that we had. we met these two guys about our age on the island who were complete hicks and decided to steal this towel from their canoe, which was resting on a rock, so i pulled on the towel but it wouldn't come off the seat, and then i pulled harder and the entire canoe falls into the water. so suzanne starts like, screaming and we're like screw it and start rowing away but suzanne does this jackie chan leap into the canoe, then about 5 seconds later realizes she doesn't know how to row, so she starts hyperventilating because she's in this canoe of these two kids we don't even know floating away from an island with noone to help her. it was so funny me and franne were laughing and crying and peeing all at the same time. just thinking about it is making me laugh out loud. madeline is looking at me like i'm crazy, so i'm going to stop recalling that little floozy. so we started to row back to the house, after getting in a fight with the hicks' flabby dad because we asked if they were from around there and they said yes and franne goes "that sucks" so the dad's like "ACTUALLY IT DOESN'T" and then starts making fun of how i only rowed like 20 feet within 40 minutes and i go "well atleast we know how to use a SUBWAY" and it was funny. man. ah, i wish i had a video camera. then we get back to the house, have about an hour of lake-fun, franne left, we got out of the water and started playing scattegories in the garden swing with tyler and trevor and it was another pee-in-your-pants episode, then we ate and just hung out and talked: very fun. me and tyler ended up getting in a fist fight because i told him i could "take him because i lived in the 'hood" and he ended up grabbing my leg and punching me in the stomach so i clawed him and he was like "TRUCE!" so we did a ghetto handshake and that was the end of it. god, i love that kid. so now i'm back, after getting lost in the boonies of new jersey with my directionless mother and my baby suzanne. 3 reasons why i love suzanne: 1. trevor "when i'm rich, i want to have an albino as a slave." me "my friend zach's brother is albino" suzanne "really?!" me "no. he's just really pale and has white hair." suzanne "so wouldn't that mean he IS an albino?" 2. "look! a deer is crossing the parkie! ...way." 3. she says "hi! have a nice dayyyy!" in this really annoying high-pitched, enthusiastic voice to everybody we passed whilst rowing.
